name: Wyatt Ogle
description: I'm a sophomore at Washington University in St. Louis studying Computer Science & Economics with minors in Finance and Spanish. I'm passionate about learning new things, and using my skills and interests to help others.

I'm a quick learner who enjoys tackling new challenges—whether that's writing code, leading teams, or exploring emerging tech. Outside the classroom, I love baseball, weightlifting, skiing, and travel.

education.school: Washington University in St. Louis – St. Louis, MO
education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science + Economics
coursework: Rapid Prototype Development and Creative Programming
AP Physics C: Mechanics - 5 on AP Exam
AP Calculus BC - 5 on AP Exam
AP English Language & Composition - 5 on AP Exam
AP English Literature - 4 on AP Exam
AP US History - 4 on AP Exam
AP Spanish Language & Culture - 4 on AP Exam

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
bullets: Working part time to develop scripts, projects, and reports to improve operations and efficiency.
Specializing in Ruby on Rails and SQL development, built several internal tools and dashboards.

experience.title: Information Technology Intern
bullets: Cultivated proficiency in Ruby, SQL, HTML, and other technologies through hands-on development.
Built 15+ projects and scripts including report generators, data analysis tools, and automation for sales and operations.
Performed daily IT operations monitoring firewalls, servers, and cloud systems.

experience.title: English Tutor
bullets: Provided one-on-one English tutoring to non-native speakers from South Korea.
Focused on improving conversation skills, grammar, and professional communication.
Helped students prepare for jobs and school opportunities in the US.

experience.title: Summer Camp Counselor
bullets: Led ceramic workshops teaching shaping, glazing, and painting techniques.
Supervised 30 children aged 5–12 to ensure a safe and inclusive environment.
Collaborated with coworkers to coordinate schedules and manage group dynamics.

Spearheaded an initiative to increase our recruitment budget by meeting and setting up calls with our Housing Corporation Treasurer and organizing a professional pitch deck resulting in $7,000 of additional funding.
Organized and planned initiatives and events to maximize recruitment yield for the 2025-26 recruitment cycle.
Helped organize, manage, and set up recruitment events for my professional business fraternity.
Managed over 200 potential new members both during events and outside of events.
Selected as one of six senior directors on the governing Board of Directors for the Firebird Fund.
Managed a $10,000 stock portfolio for Pacific Ridge School, earning a 10% annual return through market analysis.
Collaborated with other board members to make strategic investment decisions.
Coordinated a club of 40+ members to organize cheers and themed events at 20+ home games.
Created posters, pep rallies, and social media content to increase engagement.
Boosted student attendance at games by 20% through targeted outreach and content.
Led varsity baseball team to two league championships and two CIF playoff appearances.
Fostered teamwork, discipline, and resilience through consistent practice and strategy.
Bridged communication between coaches and teammates to ensure alignment and resolve conflicts.

projects.name: Internal AI Agent App
projects.description: Custom AI Agent for internal use at Lloyd Pest Control
bullets: Developed a full-stack AI Agent web app integrating DigitalOcean’s GradientAI platform with knowledgebases and function routes.
Built a chat interface with Markdown streaming, typing animations, and Google Speech-to-Text support.
Implemented PostgreSQL persistence for chat history to provide users with past conversation logs.

projects.name: Event Lead Capture Web App
projects.description: Web app to streamline trade show lead capture
bullets: Designed and deployed a lead capture app to streamline data collection at trade shows.
Integrated APIs for email validation, address verification, and AI-generated company descriptions.
Automated entry of captured leads into the company’s CRM (Clypboard).

projects.name: Workday to Google Calendar Converter
projects.description: Web app for student use to input class schedules
bullets: Developed a web app for students that allows users to upload their class schedule in xlsx format from Workday and automatically creates and imports a recurring schedule into Google Calendar.
Received Google Oauth verification allowing the fully functioning app to be deployed and public on the web.
